news_header: Massive floods in Valencia, Spain, have killed at least 95 people, prompting a national mourning and search efforts by troops and emergency services.
news_text: In the Valencia region of Spain, approximately 1,000 troops, police, and firefighters are searching for victims after devastating floods resulted in at least 95 deaths and many missing. Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez declared three days of national mourning and urged residents to stay home for their safety. The floods, described as the deadliest since 1973, brought an entire year's worth of rain in just a few hours. Many homes still lack electricity and clean water, and the death toll is expected to rise as recovery efforts continue. Sanchez and King Felipe VI expressed condolences to the victims' families, while regional officials defended their response to the disaster.
